Title: SHOW DEM CAMP: Afrika Magik, Nollywood Nostalgia, and Conceptual Hip Hop
Summary: Show Dem Camp have moved between activism, highlife romance, and hip-hop commentary . With Afrika Magik, the duo returns with a cinematic, Nollywood-inspired body of work .

Title: Train crushes 7 elephants to death in India
Summary: A passenger train smashed into a herd of elephants in India’s northeast, killing seven animals . No travellers were injured in the accident in Assam state, home to more than 4,000 elephants .

Title: UI professor, ex-REC Abdulganiy Raji, dies
Summary: Professor Abdulganiy Raji was a former Resident Electoral Commissioner (REC) in Osun State . He was a respected academic at the University of Ibadan .

Title: Musk wins US court appeal of $56 bn Tesla pay package
Summary: A Delaware appeals court cleared the way Friday for Elon Musk to receive a long-contested $56 billion Tesla pay package, reversing an earlier judgment in the protracted case . The decision by the Delaware Supreme Court rejects a pair of judgments .

Title: Coach Broos hopes to join Renard as AFCON winner with two nations
Summary: South Africa tactician Hugo Broos hopes to join Renard as AFCON winner with two nations . The 73-year-old grandfather triumphed in 2017 with South Africa . He is the only one of the 24 coaches at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco .

Title: Iran executes man accused of spying for Israel
Summary: Iran has put to death a man accused of spying for Israel, the judiciary's press agency announced Saturday . It is the latest execution since a 12-day June war between the archenemies .

Title: Police deploy special squads ahead Tinubu’s Borno visit
Summary: Borno State Police also said there would be temporary vehicular restrictions and diversions in some parts of the state . Tinubu's visit is scheduled to take place in Borno .

Title: Bandits, criminals won’t find it easy in 2026 – Guards Brigade Commander
Summary: Guards Brigade Commander: This year has been very challenging because of the increase in security demands within our area of responsibility . “In addition to our core responsibility of protecting the President, this year has also been very difficult," he said .

Title: Nigerians benefit from UK visa rules exemption for prison workers
Summary: More than 700 Nigerians had been recruited to work in UK prisons last year . The nationality accounted for 29% of job applicants in the UK prisons . Nigerians benefit from visa rules exemption for prison workers .

Title: Africa Cup of Nations: Prize money, 5 shocks of previous tournaments
Summary: Drogba missed a penalty and the match went to a shootout with defender Stophira Sunzu converting the decisive spot kick . The match ended 1-1 after a penalty was awarded by defender Sunzu in the shootout .

Title: UK calls for democratic order in W'Africa, condemns Guinea-Bissau coup, Benin attempt
Summary: The UK condemned the recent coup in Guinea-Bissau and the attempted coup in Benin . Jennifer MacNaughtan, UK Minister Counsellor, spoke at a United Nations Security Council meeting on West Africa and the Sahel . She said: “These actions undermine democratic governance across the region”

Title: No safe haven for terrorists, bandits in 2026 — Guards Brigade
Summary: The Guards Brigade of the Nigerian Army has warned terrorists, bandits and other criminal elements that they will face stiff resistance in 2026 . The Commander, Guards Brigade, Brigadier-General Adebisi Onasanya, issued the warning on Saturday during the annual ascent of Aso Rock in Abuja, an exercise marking the conclusion of brigade

Title: Yuletide:TRACE begins special traffic enforcement on Lagos-Ibadan expressway, 17 others
Summary: The Ogun State Traffic Compliance and Enforcement Agency has announced a special yuletide traffic operation across 18 major corridors in the state . The agency said the special operation, covering Christmas and New Year celebrations, would run from Monday, December 22, 2025, to Monday, January 5, 2026 . The affected corridors include the Lagos-

Title: Police unveil crime-free Yuletide campaign in Jigawa
Summary: The Jigawa State Police Command has launched a crime-free campaign aimed at ensuring peaceful and safe Christmas and New Year festivities across the state . This was disclosed in a statement made available to journalists by the state Police Public Relations Officer (PPRO), SP Shi’isu Adam, on Saturday in Dutse, the state capital

Title: Youth development at the heart of Tinubu’s agenda —  Minister
Summary: Tijani spoke on Friday while declaring open a three-day end-of-the-year basketball competition for youths tagged “Tech meets Basketball” The basketball tournament is being held at the Alake Sports Centre, Ijeja, Abeokuta, the capital of Ogun State .
